<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Implementing icons for cards**

I need to apply lucide-react icons to cards with accent placeholders in page.tsx. The Value Pillars have accent boxes, while Use Cases and Featured capabilities lack icons. Since the task indicates to apply proper icons to all cards with placeholders, I’ll focus on the 'card-feature' ones. I should import the appropriate icons and place them inside those accent divs. For example, layouts for “One workspace, zero chaos” could be LayoutGrid or FolderKanban. For “Fast by default,” the icon should be Zap, and for “Secure for serious teams,” I could use ShieldCheck or Lock.
**Updating icons in featured capabilities**

I see that there are icons not currently used, like ShieldCheck or Lock for “Secure for serious teams.” I’ll use the ShieldCheck icon since Lock is already imported. For “AI-assisted where it matters,” I can consider Sparkles or Bot. 

I also need to check if the Featured capabilities cards could have icons. Since only the feature grid has placeholders, I'll limit my edits there. I should import icons from lucide-react, replace the inner divs with icons using className 'w-6 h-6 text-accent,' and remove any unused imports, like Image. The main goal is to keep changes minimal.
**Adjusting imports and icons**

I realize it’s okay to remove unused imports if it's straightforward, but the main user request is to apply icons. Removing unused imports like Image might be seen as extra. However, I should keep it to avoid potential linter errors, even if it's not mandatory to run lints. I need to change the import line to include the specific icons: LayoutDashboard, Zap, ShieldCheck, and Sparkles from lucide-react, while removing Lock, Mail, and User imports. I'll implement this using Next.js best practices.
**Updating the file with icons**

I’m planning to update the file using apply_patch or edit_file. Since we’ve read the file, applying the patch should be straightforward. I need to ensure that the indentation aligns with the two-space format used in the file. I’ll swap the inner divs with the icon components and replace line 2 with the appropriate imports. Although I wonder about adding status updates and todo management, since this change is small, I can skip the todo list and just include a status update before the tool call. Now it’s time to perform the edit!
**Preparing the patch**

I’m getting ready to apply the patch by making some specific changes to the file. First, I’ll replace line 2, changing the import statement for Lock, Mail, and User to include LayoutDashboard, Zap, ShieldCheck, and Sparkles instead. 

Next, I’ll replace various placeholders with their corresponding icons: LayoutDashboard at lines 62-64, Zap at lines 71-73, ShieldCheck at lines 80-82, and Sparkles at lines 89-91. After making these changes, I’ll apply the patch, considering the linter might flag unused imports like Image. I just need to keep the existing quoting style, using double quotes as per the file's current format. Time to proceed!</details></think>

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: app/components/CTAButton.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 65, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,65 @@
- 
+ &#39;use client&#39;;
+ 
+ import { ArrowRight } from &#39;lucide-react&#39;;
+ import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from &#39;react&#39;;
+ 
+ interface CTAButtonProps {
+   variant: &#39;primary&#39; | &#39;secondary&#39;;
+   text: &#39;book a demo&#39; | &#39;request pricing&#39; | &#39;see more&#39; | &#39;get started&#39;;
+   className?: string;
+ }
+ 
+ const textVariants = {
+   &#39;book a demo&#39;: &#39;Book a demo&#39;,
+   &#39;request pricing&#39;: &#39;Request pricing&#39;,
+   &#39;see more&#39;: &#39;See more&#39;,
+   &#39;get started&#39;: &#39;Get started&#39;,
+ };
+ 
+ export default function CTAButton({ variant, text, className = &#39;&#39; }: CTAButtonProps) {
+   const [isVisible, setIsVisible] = useState(false);
+   const buttonRef = useRef&lt;HTMLButtonElement&gt;(null);
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
+       ([entry]) =&gt; {
+         if (entry.isIntersecting) {
+           setIsVisible(true);
+         }
+       },
+       {
+         threshold: 0.1,
+         rootMargin: &#39;0px 0px -50px 0px&#39;,
+       }
+     );
+ 
+     if (buttonRef.current) {
+       observer.observe(buttonRef.current);
+     }
+ 
+     return () =&gt; {
+       if (buttonRef.current) {
+         observer.unobserve(buttonRef.current);
+       }
+     };
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const baseClasses = &#39;btn-primary flex items-center gap-2 group transition-all duration-300&#39;;
+   const variantClasses = variant === &#39;secondary&#39; ? &#39;btn-secondary&#39; : &#39;btn-primary&#39;;
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;button
+       ref={buttonRef}
+       className={&#96;${baseClasses} ${variantClasses} ${className}&#96;}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;span&gt;{textVariants[text]}&lt;/span&gt;
+       &lt;ArrowRight 
+         className={&#96;w-4 h-4 transition-all duration-500 ${
+           isVisible 
+             ? &#39;opacity-100 translate-x-0&#39; 
+             : &#39;opacity-0 -translate-x-2&#39;
+         }&#96;}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/button&gt;
+   );
+ }
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

Perfect! I've created a reusable CTA component with the following features:

**CTAButton Component:**
- **Text variants**: 'book a demo', 'request pricing', 'see more', 'get started'
- **Style variants**: 'primary' and 'secondary' (uses existing btn-primary/btn-secondary classes)
- **Animated arrow**: Lucide ArrowRight icon that fades in from left to right when the component enters the viewport
- **Intersection Observer**: Triggers animation when scrolled into view with a 10% threshold
- **Smooth transitions**: 500ms duration for the arrow animation, 300ms for button transitions

**Implementation:**
- Replaced all existing CTA buttons in the hero section and final CTA section
- The arrow starts invisible and translated left (`opacity-0 -translate-x-2`)
- When visible, it animates to full opacity and normal position (`opacity-100 translate-x-0`)
- Each button instance will animate independently when it comes into view

The component is fully reusable and will work anywhere you need a CTA button with the animated arrow effect!

---
